name: Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with Cold Agglutinin Disease
chief_complaint: I feel extremely tired, my hands and feet turn blue in the cold, and I've been having dark urine.
prognosis: Variable - many patients achieve remission with treatment, but relapses can occur. Severe cases may require long-term management.
description: A rare form of autoimmune hemolytic anemia where IgM antibodies bind to red blood cells at cold temperatures, causing complement-mediated intravascular hemolysis. The condition is often idiopathic but may be associated with lymphoproliferative disorders or infections like Mycoplasma.
multiple_choice: Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with Cold Agglutinin Disease
